ul.li1: “Observe justice
ul.li2: and do righteousness,
ul.li1: for my salvation is close to coming,
ul.li2: and my justice to being revealed.
ul.li1: 2Happy is the man who does this,
ul.li2: and the son of humankind who keeps hold of it,
ul.li1: who keeps the Sabbath so as not to profaneLiterally “from profaning” it,
ul.li2: and who keeps his hand from doing anyOr “all” evil.”
ul.li1: 3And do not let the foreignerLiterally “son of the foreign country” who joins himself to Yahweh say, “Surely Yahweh will separate me from his people.”
ul.li2: And do not let the eunuch say, “Look! I am a dry tree!”
ul.li1: 4For thus says Yahweh, “To the eunuchs who keep my Sabbaths,
ul.li2: and choose that in which I delight,
and who keep hold of my covenant.
ul.li1: 5And I will give them a monument and a name in my house and within my walls,
ul.li2: better than sons and daughters;
ul.li1: I will give him an everlasting name
ul.li2: that shall not be cut off.
ul.li1: 6And the foreignersLiterally “sons of the foreign country” who join themselves to Yahweh to serve him
ul.li2: and to love the name of Yahweh, to become his servants,
ul.li1: every one who keeps the Sabbath, so as not to profaneLiterally “from profaning” it,
ul.li2: and those who keep hold of my covenant,
ul.li1: 7I will bring them to my holy mountain;Literally “the mountain of my holiness”
ul.li2: I will make them merry in my house of prayer.
ul.li1: their burnt offerings and their sacrifices will be acceptedLiterally “for acceptance” on my altar,
ul.li2: for my house shall be called a house of prayer for all peoples,”

chapter.p: 8declaresLiterally “declaration of” the Lord Yahweh, who gathersOr “gathering” the scattered ones of Israel (still I will gather toOr “upon” him, to his gathered ones).

ul.li1: 9All wild animals in the field, come,
ul.li2: to devour,Or “eat” all wild animals in the forest!
ul.li1: 10His watchmen are blind,
ul.li2: none of them know.
ul.li1: They are all dumb dogs;
ul.li2: they are unable to bark,
ul.li1: panting, lying down,
ul.li2: loving to slumber.
ul.li1: 11And the dogs have a greedy appetite;Literally “are strong of soul”
ul.li2: they are never satisfied.Literally “do not know satiation”
ul.li1: And they are the shepherds!
ul.li2: They do not haveOr “know” understanding.
ul.li1: They all turn to their own way,
ul.li2: each one for his own gain, every one of them.Literally “from his end “
ul.li1: 12“Come, let me take wine,
ul.li2: and let us carouse with intoxicating drink,
ul.li1: and tomorrow will be like today,
ul.li2: very great indeed.”Literally “excessively”
